text.p: A planned 24-hour strike by Public Power Corporation (PPC) workers on Wednesday could cause power cuts throughout Greece, the union (GENOP DEH) said in a statement.
"We call management to cut down power consumption by 20% in large energy-consuming industrial clients to avoid black-outs in household users," GENOP said.

The union decided to stage the 24-hour general walkout over pay rise issues, blaming the government's rigidity during a recent meeting with Industry Minister Vasso Papandreou to discuss the terms of a collective pay agreement for 1997.

"The government's reaction to social security issues, coupled with its adamant position in offering a 6.9 percent pay rise for 1997, inclusive of bracket crawl and overdues from previous agreements, exasperates PPC workers to a fighting stance," GENOP said.

Besides negotiating the terms of the collective agreement for 1997, the union met with the industry minister to discuss legislation required for the future growth of PPC and the particularities of their social security scheme.
The union has also scheduled a 48-hour strike on April 15-16 over the same issues.
